ovdesc.p: AM.CCY.HEDGE.REQUEST is the main input and control routine for the cash management workflow that handles the hedging of currency exposure relative to the portfolio reference currency.

desc.p: This field can hold a predefined criteria record from the AM.CRITERIA application. If present this criteria will be used to initially restrict the portfolios that are selected for sweeping.
This field is part of a multivalued set allowing restriction of portfolio valuation to specific asset/sub-asset combinations.
The code must be a valid asset type held in the SUB.ASSET.TYPE application
This field is part of the positional data set.
This field holds a group ID for the grouped data. This group ID will depend on the positions that are being grouped. e.g. For securities it will be the security ID.
This field is part of the additional criteria field set that can be used to further restrict the selection of portfolios for processing by the cash management service.
The contents of this field must be a valid operand.
This field is part of the positional data set.
This field holds the asset type for the grouped data.
This field is part of the positional data set.
This field holds the sub-asset type for the grouped data.
This field contains the number of working days in the future to be included when checking for cash flows resulting from equity dividends.
This field will default to the value from the same field in the relevant AM.PARAMETER record
This field holds the rounding parameter to be used to determine how amounts are to be rounded.
This field enables the rounding of the initial proposed nominal while capturing the sweep request.
It should be a multiple of trading units given in SECURITY.MASTER application.
This is applied only while capturing the request. This is not applied in case any amendments made to the intial proposed nominal.
This field is part of the positional data set.
This field holds the currency code for the grouped data.

This field hold a list of Portfolio IDs that are to be considered for Currency Hedging. This field is populated by the entry and validation of Criteria and/or Field/Operand/Value selection details but may also have values entered manually.
The contents of this field must be a valid SEC.ACC.MASTER ID
This field is part of the set of control fields which manage the cash management service
Setting this to Yes starts the cash management service.
Available options: Yes, No
This field is part of the positional data set.
This field holds a description for the grouped data.
Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.
This field holds any overrides raised by the system
This field can hold a longer description for this AM.CCY.HEDGE.REQUEST record
This is the ID of the AM.CCY.HEDGE.REQUEST record. It will appear as SOURCE.ID on any related AM.CCY.HEDGE.DETAIL records allowing these detail records to be associated with the parent request.
This field determines which type of currency hedging is to take place.
The Forward operation results in a single forward FOREX deal whilst the Swap operation results in a spot deal and a forward FOREX deal
Available options: Forward, Swap
This field is mandatory.
This field is part of the additional criteria field set that can be used to further restrict the selection of portfolios for processing by the cash management service.
The contents of this field must be a valid field name from the SEC.ACC.MASTER application.
This field contains the number of working days in the future to be included when checking for cash flows resulting from interest payments from bonds.
This field will default to the value from the same field in the relevant AM.PARAMETER record
This field contains the number of working days in the future to be included when checking for cash flows resulting from bond coupons.
This field will default to the value from the same field in the relevant AM.PARAMETER record
This field contains the number of working days in the future to be included when checking for cash flows resulting from money market repayments.
This field will default to the value from the same field in the relevant AM.PARAMETER record
This field is used to determine if the value of open security orders are to be considered when valuing the accounts.
Setting this to Yes will have the proposed purchase price of the securities removed from the value of the appropriate currency account..
Available options: Yes, No
This field allows for the entry of additional positions to be included in the currency hedging valuation.
The ID must be a valid SC.VALUATION.EXTRACT record ID and must refer to one of the portfolios listed in the field PORT.ID

This field holds the cash value beyond which a non-portfolio currency account is considered to be exposed ie portfolio accounts not in the portfolio base currency whose values are greater than this value will be considered for hedging.
This amount is expressed in system base currency
This field holds the trade date that is to be used for resulting FOREX orders.
This field defaults to the system date and must not be less than this date.
This field is mandatory
This field contains the number of working days in the future to be included when checking for cash flows resulting from FOREX contract settlements.
This field will default to the value from the same field in the relevant AM.PARAMETER record
This field enables for rounding the initial proposed nominal while capturing the sweep request.
This needs to be the valid value from the EB.ROUNDING.RULE application.
If the value is not given by the user, this field will default to the value from the same field in the relevant AM.PARAMETER record
If the proposed nominal is manually amended then the rounding is not applied at order generation level.
Rounding rule and size are associated field.
This field is part of the set of control fields which manage the cash management service
Setting this to Yes informs the cash management service that any AM.CCY.HEDGE.REQUEST records that have been flagged as requiring revaluation should be picked up and valuated.
Available options: Yes, No
This field holds the value date that is to be used for resulting FOREX orders.
This field defaults to the system date plus 2 days and must be greater or equal to the traded date.
This field is mandatory
This field is part of the set of control fields which manage the cash management service

Setting this to Yes informs the cash management service that FOREX orders should be created for all AM.CCY.HEDGE.DETAIL records relating to this request. AM.CCY.HEDGE.DETAIL records that are awaiting recalculation will not be processed.
Available options: Yes, No
This field determines whether forward flows are to be included in the valuation of currency accounts.

Setting this to Yes informs the cash management service that the value of various forward flows should be included. The number of days for each flow type can be amended elsewhere in this application and default from values entered in the AM.PARAMETER application.
Available options: Yes, No
This field is part of a multivalued set allowing restriction of portfolio valuation to specific asset/sub-asset combinations.
The code must be a valid asset type held in the ASSET.TYPE application
This field is part of the set of control fields which manage the cash management service.

Setting this to Yes informs the cash management service that the criteria and parameters entered in this application should be processed and relevent AM.CCY.HEDGE.DETAIL records should be created for the proposed sweeping FOREX trades.
Available options: Yes, No
This is a system-maintained checksum to determine when to rebuild the various stages of the request.
This field is part of the set of control fields which manage the cash management service

Setting this to Yes informs the cash management service that all existing AM.CCY.HEDGE.DETAIL records for this request should be deleted. This may not be set to Yes when the Recalculate field is set to Yes.
Available options: Yes, No
Holds the Instrument Id for CurrencyHedging.Must be a valid record in SECURITY.MASTER application.
This field contains the number of working days in the future to be included when checking for cash flows resulting from bond redemptions.
This field will default to the value from the same field in the relevant AM.PARAMETER record
This field is part of the set of control fields which manage the cash management service
Setting this to Yes informs the cash management service that any AM.CCY.HEDGE.DETAIL records that have been flagged as requiring recalculation should be picked up and recalculated.
This field does not need to be used if the AM.PARAMETER field AUTO.RECALC.CM field is set to Yes
Available options: Yes, No
This field holds the minimum amount that is to be transfered between accounts.
This amount is expressed in portfolio reference currency
This field is part of the additional criteria field set that can be used to further restrict the selection of portfolios for processing by the cash management service.
Holds the portfolios that needs to be excluded from Cash Mangement Process.
This field is part of the positional data set.
This field holds a portfolio ID for the grouped data. Where positions from more than one portfolio are being grouped, this field will be blank.
This field can hold a short description for this AM.CCY.HEDGE.REQUEST record
This field is part of the positional data set.
This field holds the position IDs that are being grouped.
The IDs refer to the table SC.VALUATION.EXTRACT
Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.
